docs.title: Commands
docs.text:
• mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project.
  • mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server.
  • mkdocs build - Build the documentation site.
  • mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.

docs.title: Project layout
docs.text:
mkdocs.yml    # The configuration file.
docs/
    index.md  # The documentation homepage.
    ...       # Other markdown pages, images and other files.

docs.title: Resume
docs.text: An experienced technical writer who excels at transforming complex information into clear, accessible documentation. I specialize in creating content for both external customers and internal engineering teams, with a track record of building original documentation for new systems and managing established documentation libraries. My philosophy is to treat documentation as code, leveraging open-source systems to foster community contribution and streamline developer workflows.

docs.title: Opentrons Labworks
docs.text:
Senior Technical Writer | February 2023 – Present

  • Co-wrote the comprehensive 150-page Opentrons Flex Instruction Manual, a user guide for the 2023 Flex Liquid Handling robot that was instrumental in helping the company achieve its $61 million revenue goal.
  • Authored the company's first-ever Flex Service Manual, a critical resource for field service engineers and third-party partners that contributed to a CY 2024 initiative designed to generate $58 million in revenue. This manual provided instructions on robot electronic components (PCBAs), connections, and service/replacement procedures.
  • Developed the Flex Annual Maintenance Guide, an internal resource that equipped service technicians with essential instructions for contracted, on-site yearly maintenance, including inspection, cleaning, and calibration.
  • Significantly improved customer experience by delivering comprehensive product documentation (including user, service, and maintenance guides) for the first time, addressing a previous lack of documentation for products shipped prior to 2023.
  • Principal author and maintainer of quick-start (print) and instruction manuals (online) for robot modules (e.g., pipettes, grippers, heater-shakers, thermocyclers). Collaborated with product managers and engineering teams to ensure documentation accuracy.
  • Supported the documentation team in transitioning from Google Docs/PDF to MkDocs for product documentation, significantly speeding up documentation creation and maintenance times.
  • Authored Python API documentation using Sphinx.
  • Writing tools: MkDocs, Sphinx, Google Docs, JIRA, GitHub

docs.title: Spotify
docs.text:
Senior Technical Writer | 2017-2022

  • Wrote developer-facing documentation for Spotify's internal system architecture. Content improved understanding among engineering teams about using internal services and how Spotify ad serving systems worked.
  • Wrote and revised training tutorials for engineers. Changes improved accuracy, trust, content adoption, and reduced confusion.
  • Created The Spotify Technical Writing Handbook, a writing and style guide for developers. Guide designed to help standardize writing style and organization in Spotify's internal documentation system.
  • Revised and managed company glossary. Changes improved content organization, definitions, standards for inclusion, and added a search feature.
  • Helped create a technical writing guild. The guild coordinated writing projects and promoted technical documentation at Spotify.
  • Writing tools: MkDocs, Markdown, JIRA, Trello, GitHub, Confluence, Coda, Loom (video), Google docs.

docs.title: Adobe Systems
docs.text:
Senior Technical Writer | 2015-2017

  • Returned to Adobe to write and manage documentation for Audience Manager. Efforts brought neglected documentation up-to-date, added API content, and eliminated issue backlog.
  • Created and organized documentation for the Marketing Cloud ID Service and the Marketing Cloud Device Co-Op. Efforts reduced support demands and allowed customers to work with these systems in a self-service manner.
  • Mentored and collaborated with a junior technical writer based in Bucharest, Romania. Efforts prepared him to take my role after leaving Adobe.
  • Writing tools: XMetaL, Oxygen (DITA authoring systems), GitHub, Confluence, Google docs.

docs.title: Tapad
docs.text:
Senior Technical Writer | 2013-2015

  • First technical writer hired. Wrote documentation for Tapad's probabilistic, cross-device ad targeting system. Documentation helped client support teams create targeted ad campaigns for external clients.
  • Worked with engineers to write API, Android, and iOS documentation.
  • Writing tools: Confluence, Google docs.

docs.title: Demdex/Adobe Systems
docs.text:
Technical Writer | 2011-2013

  • First technical writer hired. Demdex was a data management platform (DMP) acquired by Adobe in 2011. Documentation helped advertisers create, segment, target, and deliver ads to online audiences.
  • Worked with engineers to write API, Android, and iOS documentation.
  • Writing tools: Confluence, Google docs.
